Package bgu.spl.a2

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    callback  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Action<R>
    an abstract class that represents an action that may be executed using the ActorThreadPool Note for implementors: you may add methods and synchronize any of the existing methods in this class *BUT* you must be able to explain why the synchronization is needed.
    ActionA<R>  
    ActorState  
    ActorThreadPool
    represents an actor thread pool - to understand what this class does please refer to your assignment.
    ActorThreadPoolTest  
    PrivateState
    an abstract class that represents private states of an actor it holds actions that the actor has executed so far IMPORTANT: You can not add any field to this class.
    Promise<T>
    this class represents a deferred result i.e., an object that eventually will be resolved to hold a result of some operation, the class allows for getting the result once it is available and registering a callback that will be called once the result is available.
    VersionMonitor
    Describes a monitor that supports the concept of versioning - its idea is simple, the monitor has a version number which you can receive via the method VersionMonitor.getVersion() once you have a version number, you can call VersionMonitor.await(int) with this version number in order to wait until this version number changes.
